POLYGLOT.LanguagesHint: Changes the alphabet used for the languages. Requires reload, but won't reload on Save. Reseting to defaults will reload.
POLYGLOT.CustomLanguagesHint: Define a list of custom, comma separated, languages to add to the system.
POLYGLOT.ComprehendLanguagesHint: Like the Comprehend Languages spell from D&D. Input a custom language you have already set. It won't be able to be spoken or written but allows to understand all other languages.
POLYGLOT.TruespeechHint: Like the Tongues spell from D&D. Input a custom language you have already set. Its speaker understands all spoken languages (can't read Journals) and is understood by all creatures.
POLYGLOT.DefaultLanguageHint: Name of the default language to select. Keep empty to use system default.
POLYGLOT.ReplaceLanguagesHint: Replaces the system's default languages with your Custom Languages. The first language on the list becomes the new default language. Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.ScrambleGMHint: Don't translate the text for show the text for the GM (refer to the globe's color for the token's understanding). Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.enableAllFontsTitle: Add All Fonts on Language Settings
POLYGLOT.enableAllFontsHint: Makes the Polyglot fonts avilable in the Language Settings. Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.RandomizeRunesHint: Enabling this option will cause the scrambled text to appear different every time, even if the same message is repeated. Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.ExportFontsHint: Make the Polyglot fonts available for use in Foundry (in Drawings for example).
POLYGLOT.DisplayTranslatedHint: For languages that are translated in the chat window, display the original text and a translation below.
POLYGLOT.HideTranslationHint: Hides the Globe and the "Translated from" text from chat messages to players. Perfect for when you don't want to show players which language you are speaking. Requires reload.
POLYGLOT.AllowOOCHint: Choose whose users should have their messages scrambled. OOC = Out of Character.
